ARABIC: وَٱتَّبِعْ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ وَٱصْبِرْ حَتَّىٰ يَحْكُمَ ٱللَّهُ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلْحَٰكِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Follow what has been revealed to you and be steadfast until Allah's judgement comes. He is the Best of Judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Follow what is revealed to you, and persist until God pronounce His judgement; for He is the best of all judges."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And follow, (O Prophet!), whatever is revealed to you, and remain patient until Allah brings forth His judgement. He is the best of those who judge.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), follow what is revealed to you and have patience until God issues His Judgment; He is the best Judge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) follow what is divinely revealed to you, and have patience till Allah gives His command; and He is the Best of Rulers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah gives judgment. And He is the best of the judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And follow what is revealed to you and be patient till Allah should give judgment, and He is the best of the judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And follow thou what is revealed to thee; and be thou patient until God shall judge; and He is the best of judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And (O Muhammad) follow that which is inspired in thee, and forbear until Allah give judgment. And He is the Best of Judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Follow what is revealed to you, [O Prophet], and be steadfast until God gives His judgement. He is the Best of Judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And follow thou whatsoever is revealed unto thee, and endure until Allah judgeth, and He is the Best of judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And follow that which is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah issues [His] judgement, and He is the best of judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Follow thou the inspiration sent unto thee, and be patient and constant, till Allah do decide: for He is the best to decide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (O Muhammad SAW), follow the inspiration sent unto you, and be patient till Allah gives judgement. And He is the Best of judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Follow what is revealed to you, and be patient till Allah shall judge, and He is the Best of judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until God issues His judgment, for He is the Best of judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And follow what is revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and be patient until Allah will judge. And He is the best of judges.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [10:109] And follow what is revealed to you, from your Lord, and endure [patiently], the Call and their hurting [you], until God give judgement, concerning them, by giving His command, and He is the Best of Judges, the fairest of them: he [the Prophet] endured patiently until God judged that the idolaters be fought and that the People of the Scripture pay the jizya-tax. Meccan, except for verses 12, 17, and 114, which are Medinese; it consists of 123 verses, and was revealed after Yūnus.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And) Muhammad (follow that which is inspired in thee) that which you are commanded in the Qur'an regarding the conveyance of the message, (and forbear) in this conveyance (until Allah give judgement) until Allah judges between them and you, i.e. through their killing and destruction on the Day of Badr. (And He is the Best of Judges) He is the strongest of Judges: He is able to destroy them and make you triumphant'. And of the surah in which Hud is mentioned, which is Meccan in its entirety, and consists of 123 verses, 1,625 words and 6,950 letters: Surah 11: Hud And of the surah in which Hud is mentioned, which is Meccan in its entirety, and consists of 123 verses, 1,625 words and 6,950 letters:
